title: What if azir q range increased with level?
body:
Edit: of course I mean he should get compensated somehow, as he dominates high level play when strong. The goal is to create weakness so he can be buffed in other ways that creates less gap between the character's skill floor and skill ceiling (though it is natural for there to be a gap, it is way too large currently). Anyways...

Azir late game is fine, he is squishy with good mobility and DPS, but he doesn't make up for it with weakness mid-early game. He can stay back and push the wave until he gets a little
Bit of attack speed where a q+2 autos will chunk you for so much that you can hardly farm, much less kill him (especially with access to shuffle, ult, and usually barrier).

What if q range was shorter early on? This would make it harder for azir to harass, giving more champs at the very least a neutral matchup with him. It would also hit his mobility early/mid game, making his more gracious shuffle distances saved for later on. 

It doesn't matter how it's done. It could increase at random level increments, with ranks in either his q or w, or with ranks in his ult. I am personally a fond of the ult ranks, as there are fewer and very clearly defined steps that both he and his lane opponent need to learn for the range of his abilities.

replies.body:
But... he's already one of the weakest and worst mids in the game for any Azir player not at LCS-level/otherwise extremely experienced in him.
The last thing he needs is more nerfs.

You're right, and I think that's a problem. But if he's strong, he just dominates all levels of the game. He needs a change that doesn't put him over the edge in pro play but makes him a little better for people picking him up. Compensation that shrinks the gap between his skill floor and ceiling, so to speak.

Giving him such nice utility (maybe a little extra damage to minions for pushing? Throwing out ideas here) could be good in giving him fallback when he is behind, or something. I'm no design expert obviously, but I think that his early strength transitioning into late game death machine (especially in pro hands) hinders his ability to be balanced for everyone.

He's oppressive and annoying to play against.
His skillcurve is also extremely punishing to all players basically except the ones who've devoted ridiculous amounts of time (hundreds of games) and/or are LCS level players essentially.
The game is balanced around LCS. Azir is too strong in LCS, hence nerfs. Hence, he becomes really terrible in anything outside of that for the most part.

The problem is, just about everything he has is iconic to him. His passive brings back a temporary remnant of his empire. His W is literally him being the emperor and commanding his soldiers. His Q sends them flying to a new location, while his E lets him reunite with them. His ult is the denial and shutdown of enemies who would try to break into his domain of power, sending them flying back with a wall made from his own soldiers ramming into them. His combos and various tactics are all flashy and iconic, which is also important to Riot's LC$ 'cool factor' thing.

Hence, the only way to actually nerf him more would be to just completely rework him and give him various buffs/nerfs across the board. Yes, he should remain oppressive to play against. That's fine. It's not impossible to play against him, nor is it anywhere close. That's good too. However, reworking him would actually allow him to perhaps become decent outside of LCS without being broken within LCS itself.

The issue is, Azir is such an iconic, flashy, LCS-posterboy champ that it's very unlikely he'll ever be reworked. Also, people cry and whine about having to play against him all the time, leading to excessive nerfs that neuter him into trash. The same thing happened with Tahm for example. He was incredibly good a long time ago. And as a result, he got nerfed. Then he got nerfed again. Then he got nerfed again. And he's trash now. Same thing with Azir.
He's practically reworked compared to what he was when he was first released. That doesn't mean he can't use more tweaking to try and see if his current kit can work.
Yeah, but I'm just saying straight nerfs right now in his current state is pointless and just a bad idea.
what if we make azir unable to do a double soilder auto after using his q.

well he is not able to do a double auto without building some attack speed anyways, and may make him nearly useless during the very early stages of the game, having little reward for landing a q. Perhaps with compensation it could work, but making azir feel unresponsive may be an unfortunate consequence of a change like this.

as an ap champion who scales off attackspeed, Azir has longer range and higher scaling than any adc in the game, he definitely deserve to not be allow to autoattack with sand soilders from over 1k range in any stage of the game.

He's still a Mage, albeit one that relies on his right click more than most. It would be unfair to compare him too closely to other adcs. He has his pros and cons comparatively. I would disagree about the scaling bit, however, as he is unable to crit or reach as high of attack speed as a traditional adc.

he don't need to build too much attackspeed because the change previously made his w iirc passively gain him attackspeed. He don't need crit because his scaling is super high and he can summon multiple soilders, also he does aoe damage that applies 40% slow with rylais because his soilder attacks were considered single target spell by coding...

Well rylai's is 40% for both single target and AoE abilities, so it makes sense for them to slow that amount. I'm not really gonna argue with you, the numbers don't lie in that he is very weak for beginners and moderately powerful for high-level players. And that's not a great place to be.
What if we reworked his E into something else so that he isn't absurdly safe on top of having an incredibly oppressive laning phase?

I think that is definitely an option, though his alternatives are a little tied. He can't have more damage, as it is already good enough, and replacing a defensive ability with another defensive ability would seem redundant. 

I'm sure there's something super awesome that could fit, but azir is just so easy to tip over the edge.

Personally, I like his skillcurve (you have to dedicate some time and effort ot getting gud with this dude, but when you get gud, you kill everything).  However, I do think this range modification is a good idea.  Maybe, have the range at max level be larger than the current level?  Make him a mage version of vayne/jax

I dunno, it's already pretty large as is. And when you do that it might be too far for his auto attack to register consistently to the soldiers, since he'd be so close to the limit. You could always increase this range as well, but that may not be the buff that he needs to make him more balanced.
Oh, see, now, I thought you were talking about the aa range of his minions, not his order-giving range.
That's why I said q range in the title, lol.
How about decreases with level so that it  balances all aspects if the game
